grading.policies: Assignments received 1-6 days late will have 20% of the total points deducted; assignments received more than one week late will receive 0 points.

assignments.name: Homework Assignments
assignments.description: Weekly homework assignments for each module with questions selected from WileyPlus by the instructor.

assignments.name: Weekly Quizzes
assignments.description: Short (4-5) question quizzes for each module that must be completed before the live session.

assignments.name: Exams
assignments.description: Three 'Take Home' exams for this course, open-book and open-notes.

assignments.name: Discussion Boards
assignments.description: Each team will control the board on a rotating basis, creating prompts and responding to classmates.

assignments.name: Poll Everywhere Check-in
assignments.description: Students respond to a poll indicating the topics for the week that they feel need the most attention.

policies.late_work: Assignments received 1-6 days late will have 20% of the total points deducted; assignments received more than one week late will receive 0 points.
policies.academic_integrity: All students promise to be fully truthful and avoid dishonesty, fraud, misrepresentation, and deceit of any type in relation to their academic work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

important_dates: Exams will be released on the Friday Morning of Modules 5, 10, & 13 and will be due by Sunday at 10:00 p.m.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, navigating Canvas, live web conferencing using Zoom. Required equipment includes a computer with high-speed internet, a webcam, and a microphone. Required software includes Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
additional_info.support_resources: For more information about course access or support, contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) by calling 201-216-5500.

_metadata.course_description: This course will provide the student with the principles and techniques of financial and managerial accounting for technical organizations.
learning_outcomes: Critically analyze financial statements, with a full appreciation of the inherent limitations of reported financial information.
Employ ratio and trend analyzes to evaluate the condition and performance of business entities.
Apply the concepts of present value analysis to valuing assets and making appropriate business decisions.
Generate and use financial data to make effective business decisions, including make/buy, capital investment, product introduction timing, etc.
Interpret cost accounting data to support operating decisions and cost reduction efforts.
